revised_title: Incorporating Fronts and Eddies in Continental Shelf Sea Circulation Models
tldr: This article discusses the importance of considering fronts and eddies in circulation models of continental shelf seas. It highlights the impact of fronts on the circulation pattern and transport of pollutants. The author presents a three-dimensional numerical model of eddy formation in a coastal front, which reproduces many observed features, emphasizing the need for better understanding of dynamics on the frontal scale.
